required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 2 Study of a New Ophthalmic Formulation of Cyclosporine (Restasis® X) in Patients With Dry Eye Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Multi-center, Vehicle- and Sham-controlled, Randomized Study of RESTASIS® X in Patients With Moderate to Severe Dry Eye Disease

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate a new ophthalmic formulation of cyclosporine (Restasis® X) in patients with moderate to severe dry eye disease in two stages. Up to 3 doses will be studied in Stage 2 based on results from Stage 1. No patients participating in Stage 1 will participate in Stage 2 of this study. This study was terminated and Stage 2 of the study was cancelled.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: First dose of study drug to up to 24 Weeks
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) is any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation participant administered a pharmaceutical product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. An AE can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medicinal (investigational) product, whether or not related to the medicinal (investigational) product. TEAEs are AEs with an onset that occurs after receiving study drug.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Corneal Staining Score Using a 6-Point Scale
other_outcome.description: Total corneal staining with sodium fluorescein was measured in the study eye using the 6-point Oxford scale [Grade 0: <2 dots (best), Grade 1: ≥2 to ≤10 dots, Grade 2: >10 to ≤32 dots, Grade 3: >32 to ≤100 dots, Grade 4: >100 to ≤316 dots and Grade 5: >316 dots or ulcer/erosion (worst)]. The study eye was defined as the eye that received the dosing level of the treatment received. A negative change from Baseline represents a decrease in staining (improvement). Corneal Staining Score was originally registered as a Primary endpoint but it is actually an exploratory endpoint.

arm_group.description: Vehicle administered to study eye and Sham administered to non-study eye on Day 1.
Cyclosporine New Ophthalmic Formulation Dose A administered to study eye and Vehicle administered to non-study eye on Day 1.
Cyclosporine New Ophthalmic Formulation Dose B administered to study eye and Vehicle administered to non-study eye on Day 1.
Cyclosporine New Ophthalmic Formulation Dose C administered to study eye and Vehicle administered to non-study eye on Day 1.
Cyclosporine New Ophthalmic Formulation Dose D administered to the study eye and vehicle administered to the non-study eye on Day 1.
Cyclosporine New Ophthalmic Formulation Dose E administered to study eye and Vehicle administered to non-study eye on Day 1.
Cyclosporine New Ophthalmic Formulation Dose F administered to study eye and Vehicle administered to non-study eye on Day 1.
Cyclosporine New Ophthalmic Formulation Dose C administered to study eye and Vehicle administered to non-study eye on Day 1 and retreatment at Week 12 if applicable.
Cyclosporine New Ophthalmic Formulation Dose F administered to study eye and Vehicle administered to non-study eye on Day 1 and retreatment at Week 12 if applicable.

intervention.description: Vehicle of cyclosporine administered as per protocol
Sham administered to non-study eye as per protocol on Day 1
Cyclosporine New Ophthalmic Formulation administered as per protocol

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Moderate to severe dry eye disease in both eyes
- Best-corrected visual acuity (BCVA) of 20/100 or better in each eye
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of any cyclosporine preparations within 3 months
- Use of topical medications, other than artificial tears, in the eyes within 1 month
- Use of contact lenses in either eye within 1 month
- Stage 2 only: Participation in Stage 1 of this study

facility.name: Johns Hopkins University - Wilmer Eye Institute
Eye Centers of Racine and Kenosha

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This study was terminated. Stage 2 of the study was not conducted.

outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) is any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation participant administered a pharmaceutical product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. An AE can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medicinal (investigational) product, whether or not related to the medicinal (investigational) product. TEAEs are AEs with an onset that occurs after receiving study drug.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
measure.description: An adverse event (AE) is any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation participant administered a pharmaceutical product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. An AE can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medicinal (investigational) product, whether or not related to the medicinal (investigational) product. TEAEs are AEs with an onset that occurs after receiving study drug.
measure.population: Safety Population included all participants who received at least one dose of study drug.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Corneal Staining Score Using a 6-Point Scale
outcome.description: Total corneal staining with sodium fluorescein was measured in the study eye using the 6-point Oxford scale [Grade 0: <2 dots (best), Grade 1: ≥2 to ≤10 dots, Grade 2: >10 to ≤32 dots, Grade 3: >32 to ≤100 dots, Grade 4: >100 to ≤316 dots and Grade 5: >316 dots or ulcer/erosion (worst)]. The study eye was defined as the eye that received the dosing level of the treatment received. A negative change from Baseline represents a decrease in staining (improvement). Corneal Staining Score was originally registered as a Primary endpoint but it is actually an exploratory endpoint.
outcome.population: Modified Intent-to-treat (mITT) Population included all participant who received study treatment and had Baseline and at least 1 post-baseline assessment. Analyses includes participants who had data at both Baseline and Week 12.

The study eye was defined as the eye that received the dosing level of the treatment received. A negative change from Baseline represents a decrease in staining (improvement). Corneal Staining Score was originally registered as a Primary endpoint but it is actually an exploratory endpoint.
measure.population: Modified Intent-to-treat (mITT) Population included all participant who received study treatment and had Baseline and at least 1 post-baseline assessment. Analyses includes participants who had data at both Baseline and Week 12.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
